1AMELIA   Network Interface Server                                                                                          Page    3
0Loc    Object Code    Addr1 Addr2  Stmt Lv Lineno    Source Statement                    (Asmedit 3.3)  HLASM R4.0  2004/03/15 13.11
+___    ______ ____    _____ _____  ____ __ ______    ______ _________
0                                      2              ***
                                       3              ***
                                       4              ***  AMELIA  --  NETWORK ACCESS SERVER
                                       5              ***
                                       6              ***
                                       7              ***  This program runs as a separate task that OPENs the Spartacus
                                       8              ***  devices.  This program also opens Suzan paths allowing
                                       9              ***  other programs to read/write ethernet packets.
                                      10              ***
                                      11              ***  The stack conventions and some utility routines (such as SEG)
                                      12              ***  were borrowed from WYLBUR.
                                      13              ***
                                      14              ***  Written 11/86, Niz
                                      15              ***
                                      16              ***
                                      17              ***  Note:  The Spartacus K-200's "set link mode" channel command
                                      18              ***         opcode (x'2B') confuses the EXCP channel program
                                      19              ***         translation, so we use EXCPVR.  This means that this
                                      20              ***         program has to be authorized and has to page fix its
                                      21              ***         data areas.
                                      22              ***
                                      23              ***
                                      24              ***  Modifications:
                                      25              ***
                                      26              ***    05/01/87  Niz  Add minimal IP packet support.
                                      27              ***    12/01/87  JWS  Add TCP support and mini command processor.
                                      28              ***    07/15/89  jws  New host table and MX support
                                      29              ***    07/27/89  jws  K200 IO changes, new timeout logic, misc changes
                                      30              ***    09/20/89  jws  Fix MONITOR BROAD/NOBROAD bug
                                      31              ***    10/06/89  jws  Fix retransmit/timeout bugs
                                      32              ***    11/12/89  Niz  Support writes to our host (software loopback)
                                      33              ***    12/05/89  jws  Add more info to IO error msg in log
                                      34              ***    01/05/90  jws  Save partner's privs from HASPSERV JOBACCT call
                                      35              ***    06/22/90  jws  Path tracing, ACK delay change, TIMEWAIT change
                                      36              ***    06/26/90  jws  Add ISU code for name server validity checking
                                      37              ***    06/29/90  jws  More TCP trace changes
                                      38              ***    08/14/90  jws  Fix TCP out-of-sequence packet bug
                                      39              ***    09/07/90  jws  Busy (looping?) session logging
                                      40              ***    09/18/90  jws  Abort connection if data received after TCP_CLOSE

                                    1395                       MACRO                     Get TCBID hash queue head
                                    1396              &L       TIDHASH &TCBID=
                                    1397              &L       $L    R1,&TCBID
                                    1398                       CLEAR R0
                                    1399                       D     R0,=A(HASHSIZE)
                                    1400                       LR    R1,R0
                                    1401                       SLL   R1,2
                                    1402                       A     R1,NITTIDHT
                                    1403                       MEND
                                    1404
                                    1405                       MACRO                     Get IP address hash queue head
                                    1406              &L       IPHASH &IP=,&LPORT=,&RPORT=
                                    1407              &L       CLEAR R0
                                    1408                       ICM   R1,12,&RPORT
                                    1409                       ICM   R1,3,&LPORT
                                    1410                       AL    R1,&IP
                                    1411                       SLL   R1,1
                                    1412                       X     R1,&IP
                                    1413                       D     R0,=A(HASHSIZE)
                                    1414                       LR    R1,R0
                                    1415                       SLL   R1,2
                                    1416                       A     R1,NITIPAHT
                                    1417                       MEND

                                    1424                       OI    NITHXDFL,&FM*L'HXDFLADD+&CS*L'HXDFLEBC
                                    1425                       SEGLD &SEGCB
                                    1426                       ACALL HEXDUMP

                                    1447                       GBLB  &$OK
                                    1448                       GBLC  &$PSTK(0),&$PLENSTK(0),&$PFRSTK(0),&$PLRSTK(0)
                                    1449                       GBLC  &$PPTRSTK(0)
                                    1450              &L       BEGIN BLAB=&L,BLOCK=NO,TYPE=P
                                    1451              &FR      SETC  'FSR'
                                    1452              &LR      SETC  'LSR'
                                    1453              &LEN     SETC  ''
                                    1454                       AIF   ('&P1' EQ '').DO
                                    1455              &LEN     SETC  '&P1'
                                    1456                       AIF   ('&P1' NE '&P1(1)').DOC
                                    1457                      $RGLKUP &P1
                                    1458                       AIF   (NOT &$OK).DO
                                    1459              &FR      SETC  '&P1'
                                    1460              &LR      SETC  '&P1'
                                    1461              &LEN     SETC  '&P2'
                                    1462                       AGO   .DO
                                    1463              .DOC     ANOP

                                    1465              &LR      SETC  '&P1(2)'
                                    1466              &LEN     SETC  '&P2'
                                    1467                       AIF   ('&LR' NE '').DO
                                    1468              &LR      SETC  '&FR'
                                    1469              .DO      ANOP

                                    1471                       AIF   ('&LEN.L'''(1,2) EQ 'L''').RLEN
                                    1472              &REC     SETC  '&LEN'
                                    1473              &LEN     SETC  'L''&REC'
                                    1474              .RLEN   $RGLKUP &FR
                                    1475                       AIF   (NOT &$OK).ERRNR
                                    1476              &R1      SETA  &$REG#
                                    1477                      $RGLKUP &LR
                                    1478                       AIF   (NOT &$OK).ERRNR
                                    1479              &N       SETA  (&$REG#-&R1+1)*4
                                    1480                       AIF   (&N GT 0).HVL
                                    1481              &N       SETA  (16-&R1+&$REG#+1)*4
                                    1482              .HVL     ANOP
                                    1483              &$PPTR   SETA  &$PPTR+1
                                    1484              &$PSTK(&$PPTR)    SETC '&REC'
                                    1485              &$PLENSTK(&$PPTR) SETC '4+&N+&LEN'
                                    1486              &$PFRSTK(&$PPTR)  SETC '&FR'
                                    1487              &$PLRSTK(&$PPTR)  SETC '&LR'
                                    1488              &$PPTRSTK(&$PPTR)  SETC '&PTR'
                                    1489              .* Trace routine call
                                    1490                       AIF   ('&TRACE' NE 'YES').NOTRACE
                                    1491                       PTRACE &L
                                    1492              .NOTRACE ANOP
                                    1493              .*
                                    1494                       PUSH  RAR,(&FR,&LR),&LEN,PTR=&PTR
                                    1495                       AIF   ('&BASE' EQ 'NO').NBASE
                                    1496                       BASE  USING=WITH,TRACE=&TRACE,TRACEID=&L
                                    1497              .NBASE  $RGLKUP &PTR
                                    1498                       AIF   (NOT &$OK).ERRNWAR
                                    1499              &REC     SETC  '&REC-(4+&N)'
                                    1500                       AIF   ('&REC'(1,1) NE '-').DOWITH  (&REC wasn't null)
                                    1501              &REC     SETC  '@R&$REG#'

                                    1654                       DC    X'00'       IOB FLAGS 2

                                    1657                       DC    AL3(&ECB)   ECB POINTER (DUMMY ECB)

                                    7070                                                                                   
                                    7071                 TCP connection control block.  Contains state information for     
                                    7072                 a single TCP connection.  A TCP block is also built for each      
                                    7073                 port for which there is a passive open (listen) in effect.

 000822 58F0 C018            00018  8689  1                      L     R15,NITTRCUR        Get current entry address
 000826 41FF 0050            00050  8690  1                      LA    R15,L'TRCENTRY(R15) Step to next entry

 000836 50F0 C018            00018  8714  1                      ST    R15,NITTRCUR        Save current entry pointer

0                                   8944                       COPY  PINFO               Suzan "path info" format
                                    8945=            =
                                    8946=            =                                                                     
                                    8947=            =  USER PATH INFORMATION                                              
                                    8948=            =                                                                     
                                    8949=            =                                                                     
                                    8950=            =  Subsystems provides this information whenever they open user       
                                    8951=            =  paths.  The information is set with the Suzan SVC                  
                                    8952=            =  "SETINFO" call (a 1/88 Suzan SVC extension).                       
                                    8953=            =                                                                     
                                    8954=            =  Once a path is opened, a program can sense this information        
                                    8955=            =  for the partner's side of the path.                                
                                    8956=            =                                                                     
                                    8957=            =  Extended, 10/20/91, Niz                                            
                                    8958=            =  Caller ID added for Wings, 6/92, Niz                               
                                    8959=            =                                                                     
                                                      
0000000                00000 00080  8960             =PINFO    RECORD BEGIN
 000000 D7C9D5C6                    8968  1          =           DC    CL4'PINF'           Self identification
 000004 00000000                    8969  1          =           DC    F'0'                Reserved
 000008 4040404040404040            8970  1          =PINFOSYS   DC    CL8' '              Subsystem name ("WYLBUR", etc.)
 000010 4040404040404040            8971  1          =PINFOACC   DC    CL8' '              User account ("gg.uuu")
 000018 4040404040404040            8972  1          =PINFOPRJ   DC    CL8' '              Project (subgroup)
 000020 40404040                    8973  1          =PINFOCAL   DC    CL4' '              Caller ID ("AUTH" or zeros)
 000024 00000000                    8974  1          =           DC    XL4'00'             Reserved
 000028 0000000000000000            8975  1          =           DC    2F'0'               Reserved
 000030 00                          8976  1          =PINFOIFL   FLAG  ,                   Copy of KWRIFL flags
 000031 00                          8980  1          =PINFOAFL   FLAG  ,                   Copy of KWRAFL flags
 000032 FFFF                        8984  1          =PINFOLNO   DC    H'-1'               Milten line-number (or -1)
 000034 00000000                    8985  1          =PINFOID    DC    F'0'                Milten session id
 000038 4040404040404040            8986  1          =PINFONAM   DC    CL20' '             User name
 00004C 4040404040404040            8987  1          =PINFONAMX   DC   CL20' '  (Expansion if name field expands)
 000060 0000000000000000            8988  1          =PINFOTAG   DC    XL16'00'            Session tag
 000070 0000000000000000            8989  1          =           DC    XL16'00'            Reserved
 000080                00080 00080  8990             =         END

0                                  10384              
                                   10385                                                                                   
                                   10386                 NETINIT -- Routine to allocate and initialize the network         
                                   10387                   devices.  This routine is only called once.                     
                                   10388                                                                                   
                                                      
0000F50 90EF C020/4DE0_      00020 10389              NETINIT  PROC
 USING  *,R11
 000F74 58E0 BA14/0DEE       01988 10431                       ACALL AMODE24             Switch back to 24-bit mode
                                   10435                       
                                   10436                         Get read and write buffers (we take a short-cut here and     
                                   10437                           only get one VS page (4K) because we know that the length  
                                   10438                           of read and write buffers combined are less than 4K.)      
                                   10439                       
 000F7A 0700/47F0 B014_            10440                       GETMAIN RU,LV=4096,BNDRY=PAGE
 000F94 5010 C740            00740 10454                       ST    R1,NITIBUFP         First part is read buffer
 000F98 4120 15EC            005EC 10455                       LA    R2,@R1+ENETMAXL+2   Skip over read buffer
 000F9C 5020 C7B8            007B8 10456                       ST    R2,NITOBUFP         Second part is write buffer
 000FA0 4800 BA98            01A0C 10457                       SETMSG (R1),LH:=AL2(4096)
 000FA4 58E0 BA18/0DEE       0198C 10467                       ACALL FIX                 Fix page
                                   10471                       
                                   10472                         Set addresses in CCWs.  Use real addresses for EXCPVR.  
                                   10473                       
 000FAA 1F11/BF17 C5D1             10474                       L3    R1,NITSNCCW+1       Sense
 000FB0 B111 0000            00000 10482                       LRA   R1,0(R1)
 000FB4 BE17 C5D1            005D1 10483                       ST3   R1,NITSNCCW+1
                                   10485
 000FB8 1F11/BF17 C5F1             10486                       L3    R1,NITIDCCW+1       Sense id
 000FBE B111 0000            00000 10494                       LRA   R1,0(R1)
 000FC2 BE17 C5F1            005F1 10495                       ST3   R1,NITIDCCW+1
                                   10497
 000FC6 1F11/BF17 C681             10498                       L3    R1,NITLMCCW+1       Link mode
 000FCC B111 0000            00000 10506                       LRA   R1,0(R1)
 000FD0 BE17 C681            00681 10507                       ST3   R1,NITLMCCW+1
                                   10509
 000FD4 1F11/BF17 C6A1             10510                       L3    R1,NITRBCCW+1       Read and reset buffer
 000FDA B111 0000            00000 10518                       LRA   R1,0(R1)
 000FDE BE17 C6A1            006A1 10519                       ST3   R1,NITRBCCW+1
                                   10521
 000FE2 58F0 C740            00740 10522                       L     R15,NITIBUFP        Input buffer
 000FE6 B1F0 F000            00000 10523                       LRA   R15,@R15
 000FEA BEF7 C739            00739 10524                       ST3   R15,NITRDCCW+1      Read CCW
                                   10526

1AMELIA   NETTRAIL - Process trailer encapsulation packets                                                                  Page   59
0Current Usings:  (NIT,R12)
0Loc    Object Code    Addr1 Addr2  Stmt Lv Lineno    Source Statement           (Hibal 5, Asmedit 3.3)  HLASM R4.0  2004/03/15 13.11
+___    ______ ____    _____ _____  ____ __ ______    ______ _________
0                                  14177              
                                   14178                                                                                   
                                   14179                 NETTRAIL -- Routine to handle packets where the IP and TCP        
                                   14180                   headers have been placed in a trailer.  Original reason for     
                                   14181                   this varient was memory management.  These packets will be      
                                   14182                   reformatted to standard form.                                   
                                   14183                                                                                   
                                   14184                 On exit:                                                          
                                   14185                   RC = 0  Valid packet                                            
                                   14186                   RC = 4  Invalid trailer format packet                           
                                   14187                                                                                   
                                                      
0000000                00000 005EA 14188              NETTRLWA RECORD BEGIN
 000000                            14196  1           NETTRLWK   DS    XL(ENETMAXL)        Room to save data portion of pkt
 0005EA                005EA 005EA 14197                       END
-001C92 90EF C020/4DE0_      00020 14207              NETTRAIL PROC  NETTRLWA
 USING  *,R11
 USING  NETTRLWA-(4+52),R9
 001CB6 5850 C740            00740 14260                       L     R5,NITIBUFP         Read buffer ptr
 001CBA 4140 5002            00002 14261                       LA    R4,@R5+2            Ethernet header addr
 USING  ENETHDR,R4                 14262                       WITH  (ENETHDR,R4)
                                   14275                       
                                   14276                         Trailer format packets are indicated by modified type:   
                                   14277                           Type is X'1000' + (512 byte data block count).  Valid  
                                   14278                           values are X'1001' to X'1010', ie., one to 16 data     
                                   14279                           blocks in a packet (max for ethernet is 2 blocks).     
                                   14280                           Original Ethernet packet type is saved in the trailer  
                                   14281                           header.                                                
                                   14282                       
                                   14283            C          IF    ((ENETTYPE,GE,=X'1001'),AND,    If valid ethernet
 001CBE D501 B276 400C_01F2C 0000C                                   (ENETTYPE,LE,=X'1002')),BEGIN    trailer format,
 001CD2 4820 400C            0000C 14316  1                      LH    R2,ENETTYPE         Get ethernet type
 001CD6 5420 B252            01F08 14317  1                      N     R2,=X'0000001F'     Isolate data block count
 001CDA 8920 0009            00009 14318  1                      SLL   R2,9                Mult by 512 to get length
 001CDE 4130 400E            0000E 14319  1                      LA    R3,ENETDATA
 001CE2 1A32                       14320  1                      AR    R3,R2               Address of trailer
                                   14321  1
 001CE4 1F11/BF13 3002             14322  1                      L2    R1,@R3+2            Get trailer length
 001CEA 1A12                       14330  1                      AR    R1,R2               Add data length

 001CF0 4800 5000            00000 14332  1                      LH    R0,@R5              Get actual packet length count
 001CF4 1910/47D0 B05E             14333  1                      IF    (R1,GT,R0),BEGIN    If invalid length,
 001CFA 4110 B282/4100_      01F38 14348  2                        SEGWR 'Invalid trailer format packet',,NITPRSG
 001D0C 41F0 0004            00004 14366  2                        LA    R15,4               Set error RC
 001D10 47F0 B0B6            01D6C 14367  2                        EXIT  NETTRAIL             and return
 001D14                            14370  1                      END

0                                  14519              
                                   14520                                                                                   
                                   14521                 LOOPREAD -- Routine to handle receiving a packet sent from        
                                   14522                   us to us (a "loopback").  We handle the packet exactly          
                                   14523                   the same as if it came from another host.  This code            
                                   14524                   very closely resembles the NETREAD routine.                     
                                   14525                                                                                   
                                                      
0000000                00000 00044 14526              LPRDWA   RECORD BEGIN
 000000                            14534  1           LPRDPCUR   DS    F                   NITPCUR save
 000004                            14535  1           LPRDWORK   DS    XL64                Working header area
 000044                00044 00044 14536                       END
                                   14545

                                   14599                       
                                   14600                         Process all loopback packets.  
                                   14601                       
 001D9E 5850 C74C/1255_      0074C 14602              LPRDNEXT WHILE ('LT R5,NITLPQH',NZ),BEGIN  Process them all..
 001DA8 4150 5004            00004 14621  1                      LA    R5,@R5+4            Skip past link ptr
                                   14622  1                      
                                   14623  1                        Send packet just received to all paths that want it.  
                                   14624  1                      
 001DAC 4110 5002/4800_      00002 14625  1                      SETMSG @R5+2,LH:@R5        Packet addr and length
                                   14638  1

 001DB8 58E0 B172/0DEE       01F10 14640  1                      ACALL PATHMON             Check monitor paths
                                   14644  1

 001DC2                            14646  1                      LOOP  BEGIN

 001DC2 5860 6004/1266_      00004 14665  2                        WHILE ('LT R6,UPATLINK',NZ)
 001DCC D203 9038 C124 00000 00124 14682  2                        MVC   LPRDPCUR,NITPCUR
 001DD2 5060 C124            00124 14683  2                        ST    R6,NITPCUR          Set current path ptr
                                   14684  2

                                   14686  2                            get this packet.                                     
                                   14687  2                        
 001DD6 D73F 903C 903C 00004 00004 14688  2                        CLEAR LPRDWORK
 001DDC 48F0 5000            00000 14695  2                        LH    R15,@R5             Get length

 001DEC 06F0/12FF/4740_            14715  2                        DTEX  R15,'MVC LPRDWORK(0),@R5+2'  Copy packet header

                                   14771  3
 001E08 41F0 C1EC/58E0_      001EC 14772  3                          SEGCLR NITPSG
                                   14785  3                          
                                   14786  3                            Ethernet mode (return entire packet).  
                                   14787  3

 001E1E 4100 0010/41F0_      00010 14804  4                            SEG   (R1),16

1AMELIA   RCVARP - Process Received ARP Packet                                                                              Page   63
0Current Usings:  (NIT,R12)
0Loc    Object Code    Addr1 Addr2  Stmt Lv Lineno    Source Statement           (Hibal 5, Asmedit 3.3)  HLASM R4.0  2004/03/15 13.11
+___    ______ ____    _____ _____  ____ __ ______    ______ _________
0                                  15161              
                                   15162                                                                                   
                                   15163                 RCVARP - Process received ARP packet.  Update host                
                                   15164                          table, and send reply if ARP request.  The               
                                   15165                          logic follows the description in RFC-826.                
                                   15166                                                                                   
                                   15167                   On entry:                                                       
                                   15168                     R0,R1  - Ethernet packet length and address                   
                                   15169                                                                                   
                                                      
0001F5C 90EF C020/4DE0_      00020 15170              RCVARP   PROC
 USING  *,R11
                                   15212                       
                                   15213                         Copy and validity check the packet.  
                                   15214                       
 001F80 1870                       15215                       LR    R7,R0               Packet length
 001F82 186D/1AD7/41D0_            15216                       XPUSH ,,(R7),PTR=R6       Get stack space
 001F8E 18E6/18F7/1801_            15221                       MOVEL (R6),(R1),(R7)      Copy packet
 USING  ENETHDR,R6                 15239                       WITH  (ENETHDR,R6)        Ethernet header address
 001F98 4150 600E            0000E 15252                       LA    R5,ENETDATA         Point past header
 USING  ARP,R5                     15253                       WITH  (ARP,R5)            Start of ARP packet
 001F9C D501 BB14 5000_02A94 00000 15266                       IF    (ARPHRD,NE,ARPENET#),EXIT
 001FA6 D501 BB16 5002_02A96 00002 15287                       IF    (ARPPRO,NE,ENETIP#),EXIT
                                   15308            C          IF    ((ARPOP,NE,ARPREQ#),AND,
 001FB0 D501 BB18 5006_02A98 00006                                   (ARPOP,NE,ARPREP#)),EXIT
                                   15346                       
                                   15347                         If the IP address is in the host table, update the entry.  
                                   15348                       
 001FC4 BF1F 500E            0000E 15349                       L4    R1,ARPSPA           Source IP address
 001FC8 58E0 BA8C/0DEE       02A0C 15351                       ACALL GETHOST             Look up address
 001FCE 1841                       15355                       LR    R4,R1               Copy host address (or zero)
 USING  HSTTABLE,R4                15356                       WITH  (HSTTABLE,R4)
 001FD0 1244/4780 B070_            15369                       IF    ((R4,NZ),AND,(ARPSHA,NZ)),BEGIN  If have entry
 001FE0 D205 4010 5008 00010 00008 15398  1                      MVC   HSTENET,ARPSHA      Update Ethernet address
 001FE6 B205 D000      00000       15399  1                      STCK  @R13                Update time stamp
 001FEA D203 400C D000 0000C 00000 15400  1                      MVC   HSTTIME,@R13
 001FF0                            15401                       END
                                   15405                       
                                   15406                         If our IP address is the target IP address,                 
                                   15407                           - add new entry to host table if none for source IP addr  
                                   15408                           - send an ARP reply if packet is ARP request              
                                   15409                       
 001FF0 D503 5018 C034_00018 00034 15410                       IF   (ARPTPA,EQ,NITIP),BEGIN  If target is our IP addr,
 001FFA 1244/4770 B09C             15428  1                      IF    (R4,Z),BEGIN        If no host table entry
 002000 BF1F 500E            0000E 15442  2                        L4    R1,ARPSPA           Source IP address
 002004 58E0 BA90/0DEE       02A10 15444  2                        ACALL ADDHOST             Add host table entry
 00200A 1841                       15448  2                        LR    R4,R1               Copy address
 00200C D205 4010 5008 00010 00008 15449  2                        MVC   HSTENET,ARPSHA      Set Ethernet address in entry
 002012 B205 D000      00000       15450  2                        STCK  @R13                Time stamp
 002016 D203 400C D000 0000C 00000 15451  2                        MVC   HSTTIME,@R13
 00201C                            15452  1                      END
                                   15456  1
 00201C D501 BB18 5006_02A98 00006 15457  1                      IF    (ARPOP,EQ,ARPREQ#),BEGIN  If ARP request,
1AMELIA   RCVARP - Process Received ARP Packet                                                                              Page   64
0Current Usings:  (HSTTABLE,R4) (ARP,R5) (ENETHDR,R6) (*,R11) (NIT,R12)
0Loc    Object Code    Addr1 Addr2  Stmt Lv Lineno    Source Statement           (Hibal 5, Asmedit 3.3)  HLASM R4.0  2004/03/15 13.11
+___    ______ ____    _____ _____  ____ __ ______    ______ _________
0002026 D201 5006 BB1C 00006 02A9C 15475  2                        MVC   ARPOP,=Y(ARPREP#)   Set opcode to reply
 00202C D205 6000 6006 00000 00006 15476  2                        MVC   ENETDST,ENETSRC     Set Enet dest from source addr
 002032 D205 6006 C693 00006 00693 15477  2                        MVC   ENETSRC,NITETHER    Set Enet src to our Enet addr
 002038 D205 5012 5008 00012 00008 15478  2                        MVC   ARPTHA,ARPSHA       Set target Enet from sender Enet
 00203E D203 5018 500E 00018 0000E 15479  2                        MVC   ARPTPA,ARPSPA       Set target IP from sender IP
 002044 D205 5008 C693 00008 00693 15480  2                        MVC   ARPSHA,NITETHER     Set sender Enet to our Enet addr
 00204A D203 500E C034 0000E 00034 15481  2                        MVC   ARPSPA,NITIP        Set sender IP to our IP addr
 002050 1816/1807/41F0_            15482  2                        SEGWR (R6),(R7),NITOSG    Write packet
 00205E                            15508  1                      END
 00205E                            15512                       END
 00205E 18D9/980C D004_            15516                       PEND

1AMELIA   XMITIP - Transmit IP packet                                                                                       Page   65
0Current Usings:  (NIT,R12)

+___    ______ ____    _____ _____  ____ __ ______    ______ _________
0                                  15552              
                                   15553                                                                                   
                                   15554                 XMITIP -- Transmit IP packet.  Caller provides packet data        
                                   15555                           plus a skeleton IP header which contains the dest       
                                   15556                           IP address, the TOS field, and the protocol type.       
                                   15557                                                                                   
                                   15558                   On entry:                                                       
                                   15559                     R0,R1  - packet data length and address                       
                                   15560                     R15    - address of skeleton IP header                        
                                   15561                                                                                   
                                   15562                   On exit:                                                        
                                   15563                     R15=0  - packet transmitted                                   
                                   15564                     R15=4  - Ethernet address unknown                             
                                   15565                                                                                   
                                                      
0000000                00000 00022 15566              XMITIPW  RECORD BEGIN
 000000                            15574  1           XIPENET    DS    CL(L'ENETHDR)       Ethernet header work area
 00000E                            15575  1           XIPHDR     DS    CL(L'IPHDR)         IP header work area
 000022                00022 00022 15576                       END
-00206C 90EF C020/4DE0_      00020 15586              XMITIP   PROC  XMITIPW
 USING  *,R11
 USING  XMITIPW-(4+52),R9
 002090 1871                       15639                       LR    R7,R1               Data address
 002092 1860                       15640                       LR    R6,R0               Data length
                                   15641                       
                                   15642                         Build new IP header from caller's header.  
                                   15643                       
 002094 D213 9046 F000 0000E 00000 15644                       MVC   XIPHDR,@R15         Copy caller's header
 00209A 4150 9046            0000E 15645                       LA    R5,XIPHDR           IP header area
 USING  IPHDR,R5                   15646                       WITH  (IPHDR,R5)
 00209E 9245 5000      00000       15659                       MVI   IPIHL,X'45'         Version 4 + header length
 0020A2 4000 5004            00004 15660                       STH   R0,IPID             Use low bytes as id
 0020A6 D200 5008 C100 00008 00100 15661                       MVC   IPTTL,NITIPTTL      Set time to live
 0020AC D203 500C C034 0000C 00034 15662                       MVC   IPSRC,NITIP         Source IP address
                                   15663                       
                                   15664                         Build Ethernet header.  
                                   15665                       
 0020B2 5810 5010            00010 15666                       L     R1,IPDST            Get dest IP address
 0020B6 58E0 B988/0DEE       02A18 15667                       ACALL GETENET             Get Ethernet address
 0020BC 4780 B038            020C8 15671                       IF    NZ,BEGIN            If unknown,
 0020C0 41F0 0004            00004 15682  1                      LA    R15,4               Set return code
 0020C4 47F0 B14E            021DE 15683  1                      EXIT  XMITIP              Return to caller
 0020C8                            15686                       END
 0020C8 4120 9038            00000 15690                       LA    R2,XIPENET
 USING  ENETHDR,R2                 15691                       USING ENETHDR,R2
 0020CC 9001 2000            00000 15700                       STM   R0,R1,ENETDST       Set in Ethernet header
 0020D0 D205 2006 C693 00006 00693 15701                       MVC   ENETSRC,NITETHER    Our Ethernet address
 0020D6 D201 200C BA0E 0000C 02A9E 15702                       MVC   ENETTYPE,=Y(ENETIP#)  Packet type
 DROP   ENETHDR,R2                 15703                       DROP  R2
1AMELIA   XMITIP - Transmit IP packet                                                                                       Page   66
0Current Usings:  (IPHDR,R5) (XMITIPW-(4+52),R9) (*,R11) (NIT,R12)
0Loc    Object Code    Addr1 Addr2  Stmt Lv Lineno    Source Statement           (Hibal 5, Asmedit 3.3)  HLASM R4.0  2004/03/15 13.11
+___    ______ ____    _____ _____  ____ __ ______    ______ _________
0                                  15710                       
                                   15711                         Transmit packet, generating IP fragment packets if needed.  
                                   15712                       
 0020DC 1B44                       15713                       CLEAR R4                  Init data offset
 0020DE                            15717                       LOOP  BEGIN
 0020DE 1804                       15723  1                      LR    R0,R4               Copy fragment offset
 0020E0 8800 0003            00003 15724  1                      SRL   R0,3                Divide by 8
 0020E4 4000 5006            00006 15725  1                      STH   R0,IPFRAG           Set fragment offset in header
 0020E8 1826                       15726  1                      LR    R2,R6               Data length for this packet
 0020EA 5920 B98C/47D0_      02A1C 15727  1                      CEIL  R2,ENETMAXL-L'ENETHDR-L'IPHDR  Truncate to Enet max
 0020F6 1926/47B0 B070             15746  1                      IF    (R2,LT,R6),BEGIN    If not writing all data,
 0020FC 9620 5006      00006       15761  2                        OI    IPFRAG,X'20'        Indicate more fragments coming
 002100                            15762  1                      END
 002100 4102 0014            00014 15766  1                      LA    R0,L'IPHDR(R2)      Get length of this packet
 002104 4000 5002            00002 15767  1                      STH   R0,IPLEN            Set in header
 002108 D701 500A 500A 0000A 0000A 15768  1                      CLEAR IPHDRCHK            Clear checksum
 00210E 1815/4100 0014_            15775  1                      CHECKSUM IPHDR            Checksum header
 00211C 40F0 500A            0000A 15797  1                      STH   R15,IPHDRCHK        Set in header
 002120 4110 9038/4100_      00000 15798  1                      SEG   XIPENET,L'XIPENET+L'XIPHDR,NITOSG   Write headers
 002132 1817                       15827  1                      LR    R1,R7               Copy data address
 002134 1A72                       15828  1                      AR    R7,R2               Update data pointer
 002136 1B62                       15829  1                      SR    R6,R2               Reduce remaining length
 002138 1A42                       15830  1                      AR    R4,R2               Update data offset
 00213A 1802/41F0 C7BC_            15831  1                      SEGWR (R1),(R2)           Write data and send packet
 002146 1266/4780 B0C0             15856  1                      IF    (R6,Z),EXIT         Exit if no more data
 00214C 47F0 B04E            020DE 15873                       END
                                   15878                       
                                   15879                         Update packet statistics  
                                   15880                       
 002150 5810 5010            00010 15881                       L     R1,IPDST
 002154 58E0 B980/0DEE       02A10 15882                       ACALL ADDHOST             Get host table entry

 00215A 9501 5009/4770_00009       15899                       IF    (IPTYPE,EQ,IPICMP#),BEGIN
 002162 4100 0001/5E00_      00001 15917  1                      INCR  R0,NITSICMP         ICMP send total
 00216E 4100 0001/5E00_      00001 15923  1                      INCR  R0,HSTSICMP         ICMP host total
 00217A                            15929                       END
 00217A B0EE/47F0 B10E_0217A 02160 15933                       ELSEIF (IPTYPE,EQ,IPTCP#),BEGIN
 002186 4100 0001/5E00_      00001 15960  1                      INCR  R0,NITSTCP          TCP send total
 002192 4100 0001/5E00_      00001 15966  1                      INCR  R0,HSTSTCP          TCP host total
 00219E                            15972                       END
 00219E B112/47F0 B132_0219E 02184 15976                       ELSEIF (IPTYPE,EQ,IPUDP#),BEGIN
 0021AA 4100 0001/5E00_      00001 16003  1                      INCR  R0,NITSUDP          UDP send total
 0021B6 4100 0001/5E00_      00001 16009  1                      INCR  R0,HSTSUDP          UDP host total
 0021C2                            16015                       END

 0021DE                            16042                       END

0                                  16082              
                                   16083                                                                                   
                                   16084                 XMITUDP -- Transmit UDP packet.                                   
                                   16085                                                                                   
                                   16086                   Transmit UDP packet after computing the checksum.               
                                   16087                                                                                   
                                   16088                   On entry:                                                       
                                   16089                     R1    - Packet address                                        
                                   16090                     R15   - IP address of packet                                  
                                   16091                                                                                   
                                                      
0000000                00000 00020 16092              XMITUDPW RECORD BEGIN
 000000                            16100  1           XMUDPIPH   DS    CL(L'IPHDR)         IP header work area
 000014                            16101  1           XMUDPPHD   DS    CL12                UDP pseudo-header work area
 000020                00020 00020 16102                       END
-0021EC 90EF C020/4DE0_      00020 16112              XMITUDP  PROC  XMITUDPW
 USING  *,R11
 USING  XMITUDPW-(4+52),R9
 002210 D71F 9038 9038 00000 00000 16165                       CLEAR XMITUDPW            Clear work area
 002216 1821                       16172                       LR    R2,R1               Copy UDP header address
 USING  UDPHDR,R2                  16173                       WITH  (UDPHDR,R2)         Caller's UDP header
 002218 4830 2004            00004 16186                       LH    R3,UDPLEN           Get UDP packet length
 00221C 184F                       16187                       LR    R4,R15              Copy IP address
                                   16188                       
                                   16189                         Build pseudo-header and compute UDP checksum.  
                                   16190                       
 00221E D701 2006 2006 00006 00006 16191                       CLEAR UDPCHK              Clear checksum
 002224 D203 904C C034 00014 00034 16198                       MVC   XMUDPPHD(4),NITIP   Build pseudo-header
 00222A 5040 9050            00018 16199                       ST    R4,XMUDPPHD+4
 00222E D201 9054 B890 0001C 02AA0 16200                       MVC   XMUDPPHD+8(2),=Y(IPUDP#)
 002234 4030 9056            0001E 16201                       STH   R3,XMUDPPHD+10
 002238 4110 904C/4100_      00014 16202                       CHECKSUM XMUDPPHD,FINAL=NO  Checksum pseudo-header
 00224A 1812/1803/58E0_            16225                       CHECKSUM (R2),(R3),(R15)    Checksum packet
 002254 40F0 2006            00006 16245                       STH   R15,UDPCHK            Set checksum in header
                                   16246                       
                                   16247                         Build skeleton IP header and send packet.  
                                   16248                       
 002258 4150 9038            00000 16249                       LA    R5,XMUDPIPH         IP work area
 USING  IPHDR,R5                   16250                       WITH  (IPHDR,R5)
 00225C 9211 5009      00009       16263                       MVI   IPTYPE,IPUDP#       Protocol id
 002260 5040 5010            00010 16264                       ST    R4,IPDST            Dest IP address
 002264 41F0 5000            00000 16265                       LA    R15,IPHDR           IP header address
 002268 1803                       16266                       LR    R0,R3               UDP packet length
 00226A 1812                       16267                       LR    R1,R2               UDP packet address
 00226C 58E0 B818/0DEE       02A28 16268                       ACALL XMITIP              Call IP transmit routine
 002272 18D9/980C D004_            16272                       PEND
 DROP   IPHDR,R5
 DROP   UDPHDR,R2
 DROP   XMITUDPW-(4+52),R9
 DROP   *,R11
1AMELIA   RCVIP - Process received IP packet                                                                                Page   68
0Current Usings:  (NIT,R12)

0                                  16308              
                                   16309                                                                                   
                                   16310                 RCVIP - Process received IP packet.  Call higher                  
                                   16311                           level protocol handling routines.  If the               
                                   16312                           packet is a fragment, perform assembly.                 
                                   16313                                                                                   
                                   16314                 On entry:  R0,R1 = Ethernet packet length and address             
                                   16315                                                                                   
                                                      
0002280 90EF C020/4DE0_      00020 16316              RCVIP    PROC
 USING  *,R11
 0022A4 1871                       16358                       LR    R7,R1               Packet address
 0022A6 1860                       16359                       LR    R6,R0               Packet length
 USING  ENETHDR,R7                 16360                       WITH  (ENETHDR,R7)        Ethernet header
 0022A8 4150 700E            0000E 16373                       LA    R5,ENETDATA         Point to IP header
 USING  IPHDR,R5                   16374                       WITH  (IPHDR,R5)
                                   16387
 0022AC D603 500C 500C_0000C 0000C 16388                       IF    (IPSRC,Z),RCVIPXIT  Flakey IP addr, scram
                                   16407                       
                                   16408                         Check destination address to see if IP is really for us.  
                                   16409                       
 0022B6 D503 5010 C034_00010 00034 16410                       IF    (IPDST,NE,NITIP),BEGIN  Not explicitly for us...
                                   16428  1                      
                                   16429  1                        If destination is not specifically for us, it could be an  
                                   16430  1                          IP broadcast address.                                    
                                   16431  1                      
 0022C0 9501 5009/4770_00009       16432  1                      IF    (IPTYPE,NE,IPICMP#),RCVIPXIT  Not ICMP, forget it
                                   16453  1
 0022C8 4100 0004            00004 16454  1                      LA    R0,4                Loop counter
 0022CC 4110 5010            00010 16455  1                      LA    R1,IPDST            Dest IP address
 0022D0 4120 C034            00034 16456  1                      LA    R2,NITIP            Our IP address
 0022D4 1200/47D0 B056             16457  1                      WHILE (R0,P),BEGIN
                                   16473  2         C              IF    (('CLC @R1(1),@R2',NE),AND,   If byte doesn't match
 0022DA D500 1000 2000_00000 00000        2                              (@R1,NE,X'FF')),RCVIPXIT  and not 'FF', return
 0022EC 5E10 B788            02A2C 16504  2                        INCR  R1
 0022F0 5E20 B788            02A2C 16507  2                        INCR  R2
 0022F4 0600                       16510  2                        DECR  R0
 0022F6 47F0 B030            022D4 16512  1                      END
 0022FA                            16517                       END
                                   16521                       
                                   16522                         Validity check length fields.  
                                   16523                       
 0022FA 4B60 B7FE            02AA2 16524                       SH    R6,=Y(L'ENETHDR)    Get Ethernet data length
 0022FE 4320 5000            00000 16525                       IC    R2,IPIHL            Get IP header length
 002302 5420 B78C            02A30 16526                       N     R2,=A(15)           Isolate length
 002306 8920 0002            00002 16527                       SLL   R2,2                Get header length in bytes
                                   16528            C          IF    (('CLM R6,3,IPLEN',L),OR, If packet length invalid
                                                    C                ('CLM R2,3,IPLEN',H),OR, or hdr len gt packet len
 00230A BD63 5002/4740_      00002                                   (R2,LT,L'IPHDR)),BEGIN    or hdr len too small,
 002322 4110 B81E/4100_      02AC2 16567  1                      SEGWR 'Invalid IP packet received:',,NITPRSG   log error
 002334 1815/1806/9600_            16585  1                      HEXDUMP IPHDR,(R6)        Dump it
 002346 47F0 B226            024CA 16613  1                      EXIT  RCVIP               Return to caller
 00234A                            16616                       END

0                                  17119              
                                   17120                                                                                   
                                   17121                      RCVICMP - Process received ICMP packet.  If the packet       
                                   17122                               is an ICMP echo, send an echo reply.                
                                   17123                                                                                   
                                   17124                      On entry:                                                    
                                   17125                        R0  - IP packet length                                     
                                   17126                        R1  - IP packet address                                    
                                   17127                                                                                   
                                                      
00024D8 90EF C020/4DE0_      00020 17128              RCVICMP  PROC
 USING  *,R11
 0024FC 5900 B564/4720_      02A60 17170                       IF    (R0,GT,8000),EXIT   Check length
 002504 1850                       17190                       LR    R5,R0               Save length
 002506 186D/1AD5/41D0_            17191                       XPUSH ,,(R5),PTR=R6       Get packet work area
 002512 18E6/18F5/1801_            17196                       MOVEL (R6),(R1),(R5)      Copy packet data
 USING  IPHDR,R6                   17214                       WITH  (IPHDR,R6)
 00251C 4320 6000            00000 17227                       IC    R2,IPIHL            IP header length
 002520 5420 B534            02A30 17228                       N     R2,=A(15)           Isolate length
 002524 8920 0002            00002 17229                       SLL   R2,2                Get length in bytes
 002528 1B52                       17230                       SR    R5,R2               Get ICMP packet length
 00252A 5950 B568/4740_      02A64 17231                       IF    (R5,LT,4),EXIT      Check length
 002532 4142 6000            00000 17251                       LA    R4,IPHDR(R2)        Get ICMP packet start addr
 USING  ICMPHDR,R4                 17252                       WITH  (ICMPHDR,R4)
                                   17265                       
                                   17266                         Checksum packet  
                                   17267                       
 002536 D601 4002 4002_00002 00002 17268                       IF    (ICMPCHK,NZ),BEGIN
 002540 1814/1805/1BFF_            17284  1                      CHECKSUM ICMPHDR,(R5)
 00254C 59F0 B540/4780_      02A3C 17306  1                      IF    (R15,NE,=A(X'FFFF')),BEGIN
 002554 4110 B5FA/4100_      02AF6 17322  2                        SEG   'ICMP checksum error  IPSRC=',,NITPRSG
 002566 5810 600C/41F0_      0000C 17339  2                        SEGIP IPSRC
 002574 1B00/41F0 C4B0_            17356  2                        SEGWR
 002580 47F0 B1B8            026B4 17380  2                        EXIT  RCVICMP             Exit, drop packet
 002584                            17383  1                      END
 002584                            17387                       END
                                   17391                       
                                   17392                         If echo message, Send echo reply  
                                   17393                       
 002584 9508 4000/4770_00000       17394                       IF    (ICMPTYPE,EQ,ICMPECM#),BEGIN
 00258C D203 6010 600C 00010 0000C 17412  1                      MVC   IPDST,IPSRC         Swap IP source and dest
 002592 D203 600C C034 0000C 00034 17413  1                      MVC   IPSRC,NITIP         Set our IP addr as source
 002598 9200 4000      00000       17414  1                      MVI   ICMPTYPE,ICMPECR#   Set type code
 00259C D701 4002 4002 00002 00002 17415  1                      CLEAR ICMPCHK             Clear checksum
 0025A2 1814/1805/1BFF_            17422  1                      CHECKSUM ICMPHDR,(R5)     Checksum ICMP packet
 0025AE 40F0 4002            00002 17444  1                      STH   R15,ICMPCHK         Set in packet
                                   17445  1
 0025B2 41F0 6000            00000 17446  1                      LA    R15,IPHDR           Point to IP header
 0025B6 1805                       17447  1                      LR    R0,R5               ICMP length
 0025B8 4110 4000            00000 17448  1                      LA    R1,ICMPHDR          ICMP start address
 0025BC 58E0 B52C/0DEE       02A28 17449  1                      ACALL XMITIP              Call IP transmit routine
 0025C2 47F0 B1B8            026B4 17453  1                      EXIT  RCVICMP             Return
 0025C6                            17456                       END
1AMELIA   RCVICMP - Process Received ICMP Packet                                                                            Page   72
0Current Usings:  (ICMPHDR,R4) (IPHDR,R6) (*,R11) (NIT,R12)
0Loc    Object Code    Addr1 Addr2  Stmt Lv Lineno    Source Statement           (Hibal 5, Asmedit 3.3)  HLASM R4.0  2004/03/15 13.11
+___    ______ ____    _____ _____  ____ __ ______    ______ _________
0                                  17460                       
                                   17461                         Log other message types  
                                   17462                       
                                   17463              **       SEGDEF NITPRSG
                                   17464              **       SEGB  'ICMP received from'
                                   17465              **       SEGIP IPSRC
                                   17466              **       IF    (ICMPTYPE,EQ,3),BEGIN   If dest unreachable,
                                   17467              **       IF    (ICMPCODE,EQ,0),'SEGB " Net unreachable"'
                                   17468              **       IF    (ICMPCODE,EQ,1),'SEGB " Host unreachable"'
                                   17469              **       IF    (ICMPCODE,EQ,2),'SEGB " Protocol unreachable"'
                                   17470              **       IF    (ICMPCODE,EQ,3),'SEGB " Port unreachable"'
                                   17471              **       IF    (ICMPCODE,GE,4),BEGIN
                                   17472              **       SEG   ' Dest unreachable  Code='
                                   17473              **       SEGDC LC:ICMPCODE
                                   17474              **       END
                                   17475              **       SEG   '  '
                                   17476              **       SEGIP L:ICMPDATA+4+IPDST-IPHDR
                                   17477              **       SEGWR ,
                                   17478              **       END
                                   17479              **       ELSEIF (ICMPTYPE,EQ,4),BEGIN
                                   17480              **       SEGB  ' Source quench'
                                   17481              **       SEGIP L:ICMPDATA+IPDST-IPHDR
                                   17482              **       SEGWR ,
                                   17483              **       END
                                   17484              **       ELSEIF (ICMPTYPE,EQ,5),BEGIN     Else if redirect,
                                   17485              **       SEGB  ' Redirect message  Code='
                                   17486              **       SEGDC LC:ICMPCODE
                                   17487              **       SEG   '  '
                                   17488              **       SEGIP L:ICMPDATA+IPDST-IPHDR
                                   17489              **       SEGWR ,
                                   17490              **       END
                                   17491              **       ELSEIF (ICMPTYPE,EQ,10),BEGIN    Else if time exceeded,
                                   17492              **       IF    (ICMPCODE,EQ,0),BEGIN
                                   17493              **       SEGB  ' TTL exceeded'
                                   17494              **       END
                                   17495              **       ELSEIF (ICMPCODE,EQ,1),BEGIN
                                   17496              **       SEGB  ' Reassembly time exceeded'
                                   17497              **       END
                                   17498              **       END
                                   17499              **       ELSE  BEGIN                      Else other msg type,
                                   17500              **       SEG   ' Type='
                                   17501              **       SEGDC LC:ICMPTYPE
                                   17502              **       SEG   ' Code='
                                   17503              **       SEGDC LC:ICMPCODE
                                   17504              **       SEGWR ,
                                   17505              **       SH    R5,=Y(ICMPDATA-ICMPHDR)
                                   17506              **       HEXDUMP ICMPDATA,(R5)
                                   17507              **       END
                                   17508                       
                                   17509                         Look for TCP connection matching this packet  
                                   17510                       
 0025C6 4160 4008            00008 17511                       LA    R6,ICMPDATA+4       Point to IP header inside packet
                                   17512                       WITH  (IPHDR,R6)
 0025CA 9506 6009/4770_00009       17516                       IF    (IPTYPE,NE,IPTCP#),EXIT   Return if not TCP packet
1AMELIA   RCVICMP - Process Received ICMP Packet                                                                            Page   73

0Loc    Object Code    Addr1 Addr2  Stmt Lv Lineno    Source Statement           (Hibal 5, Asmedit 3.3)  HLASM R4.0  2004/03/15 13.11

00025D2 4330 6000            00000 17537                       IC    R3,IPIHL            IP header length
 0025D6 5430 B534            02A30 17538                       N     R3,=A(15)           Isolate length
 0025DA 8930 0002            00002 17539                       SLL   R3,2                Get length in bytes
 0025DE 4133 6000            00000 17540                       LA    R3,IPHDR(R3)        Point to TCP header
 USING  TCPHDR,R3                  17541                       WITH  (TCPHDR,R3)
 0025E2 4105 4004            00004 17554                       LA    R0,ICMPDATA(R5)     End of packet
 0025E6 4110 3004            00004 17555                       LA    R1,TCPDST+2         Point into TCP header
 0025EA 1910/47D0 B10A             17556                       IF    (R1,GT,R0),BEGIN    If don't have start of TCP hdr,
 0025F0 4110 B615/4100_      02B11 17571  1                      SEGWR 'ICMP packet error',,NITPRSG
 002602 47F0 B1B8            026B4 17589  1                      EXIT  RCVICMP
 002606                            17592                       END
 002606 5880 C0D0            000D0 17596                       L     TCBR,NITTCBQ        TCB queue head
 USING  TCB,R8                     17597                       WITH  (TCB,TCBR)
 00260A 1288/4780 B13A             17610                       WHILE (TCBR,NZ),BEGIN
                                   17626  1         C            IF    ((TCBIPADD,EQ,IPDST),AND,
                                          1         C                  (TCPSRC,EQ,TCBLPORT+2),AND,
 002610 D503 8028 6010_00028 00010        1                            (TCPDST,EQ,TCBRPORT+2)),EXIT
 00262E 5880 8004            00004 17679  1                      L     TCBR,TCBNEXT
 002632 47F0 B10E            0260A 17680                       END
                                   17685
 002636 1288/4780 B1B8             17686                       IF    (TCBR,Z),EXIT       Return if TCB not found
                                   17703                       
                                   17704                         If unreachable message for connection that is just  
                                   17705                         opening, abort it.                                  
                                   17706                         If source quench, set flag for TCP routines.        
                                   17707                       
                                   17708            C          IF    ((ICMPTYPE,EQ,3),AND,
                                                    C                ((TCBSTATE,EQ,SYNSENT),OR,
 00263C 9503 4000/4770_00000                                         (TCBSTATE,EQ,SYNRECVD))),BEGIN
 002654 4110 B626/4100_      02B22 17760  1                      SETMSG 'Network error'
 00265C 9500 4001/4770_00001       17764  1                      IF    (ICMPCODE,EQ,0),'SETMSG "Net unreachable"'
 00266C 9501 4001/4770_00001       17791  1                      IF    (ICMPCODE,EQ,1),'SETMSG "Host unreachable"'
 00267C 9502 4001/4770_00001       17818  1                      IF    (ICMPCODE,EQ,2),'SETMSG "Protocol unreachable"'
 00268C 9503 4001/4770_00001       17845  1                      IF    (ICMPCODE,EQ,3),'SETMSG "Port unreachable"'
 00269C 58E0 B580/0DEE       02A7C 17872  1                      ACALL ABORTTCB
 0026A2                            17876                       END
 0026A2 B1AA/B1AA/47F0_026A2 02642 17880                       ELSE  BEGIN
 0026A6 9504 4000/4770_00000       17893  1                      IF    (ICMPTYPE,EQ,4),BEGIN  If source quench,
 0026AE D203 8074 8070 00074 00070 17911  2                        MVC   TCBCWIND,TCBSMSS       Reset congestion window to MSS
 0026B4                            17912  1                      END
                                   17916  1           *
                                   17917  1           **       SEGWR 'TCB matches ICMP message:',,NITPRSG
                                   17918  1           **       CLEAR R0                  Standard format requested

                                   17921  1           **       ACALL FMTTCB              Log TCB info

0                                  17967              
                                   17968                                                                                   
                                   17969                 RCVUDP -- Process received UDP packet                             
                                   17970                                                                                   
                                   17971                      Validity check packet fields and call packet                 
                                   17972                      processing routine.                                          
                                   17973                                                                                   
                                   17974                 On entry:                                                         
                                   17975                      R0  - IP Packet length                                       
                                   17976                      R1  - IP packet address                                      
                                   17977                                                                                   
                                                      
00026C2 90EF C020/4DE0_      00020 17978              RCVUDP   PROC
 USING  *,R11
 0026E6 1861                       18020                       LR    R6,R1               IP header address
 USING  IPHDR,R6                   18021                       WITH  (IPHDR,R6)
 0026E8 1850                       18034                       LR    R5,R0               Save IP packet length
 0026EA 4320 6000            00000 18035                       IC    R2,IPIHL            IP header length
 0026EE 5420 B34A            02A30 18036                       N     R2,=A(15)           Isolate length
 0026F2 8920 0002            00002 18037                       SLL   R2,2                Get length in bytes
 0026F6 1B52                       18038                       SR    R5,R2               Get UDP packet length
 0026F8 4142 6000            00000 18039                       LA    R4,IPHDR(R2)        Get UDP packet start addr
 USING  UDPHDR,R4                  18040                       WITH  (UDPHDR,R4)
 0026FC 4950 4004/4740_      00004 18053                       IF    (R5,LT,UDPLEN),EXIT  Check length
 002704 4850 4004            00004 18073                       LH    R5,UDPLEN            Get UDP length
 002708 5950 B39A/47C0_      02A80 18074                       IF    (R5,LE,8),EXIT       Validity check
                                   18094                       
                                   18095                         Ignore packet if not name server message  
                                   18096                       
 002710 D501 B3C0 4002_02AA6 00002 18097                       IF    (UDPDST,NE,UDPNS#),EXIT
                                   18118

                                   18120

 002724 182D/41D0 D00C             18137  1                      XPUSH ,,12,PTR=R2         Space for pseudo-header
 00272A D203 2000 600C 00000 0000C 18140  1                      MVC   @R2(4),IPSRC        IP src address
 002730 D203 2004 6010 00004 00010 18141  1                      MVC   @R2+4(4),IPDST      IP dest address
 002736 D201 2008 B3BA 00008 02AA0 18142  1                      MVC   @R2+8(2),=Y(IPUDP#)  Protocol type

 002740 1812/4100 000C_            18144  1                      CHECKSUM (R2),12,FINAL=NO Checksum pseudo-header
 002750 1814/1805/58E0_            18167  1                      CHECKSUM (R4),(R5),(R15)  Checksum packet data
 00275A 18D2                       18187  1                      XPOP  PTR=R2
                                   18189  1
 00275C 59F0 B356/4780_      02A3C 18190  1                      IF    (R15,NE,=A(X'FFFF')),BEGIN  If checksum error,
 002764 182F                       18206  2                        LR    R2,R15

1AMELIA   RCVFRAG - Process received IP packet fragment                                                                     Page   76
0Current Usings:  (NIT,R12)
0Loc    Object Code    Addr1 Addr2  Stmt Lv Lineno    Source Statement           (Hibal 5, Asmedit 3.3)  HLASM R4.0  2004/03/15 13.11
+___    ______ ____    _____ _____  ____ __ ______    ______ _________
0                                  18385              
                                   18386                                                                                   
                                   18387                 RCVFRAG -- Process received IP packet fragment.                   
                                   18388                                                                                   
                                   18389                      If the fragment completes a packet, the packet is            
                                   18390                      assembled and returned to the caller.  Otherwise             
                                   18391                      the fragment is added to the fragment queue.                 
                                   18392                                                                                   
                                   18393                   On entry:                                                       
                                   18394                     R1  - IP packet address                                       
                                   18395                                                                                   
                                   18396                   On exit                                                         
                                   18397                     R15=0   R0,R1 contain complete packet length and address      
                                   18398                     R15=4   Complete packet not received yet                      
                                   18399                                                                                   
                                                      
0                                  18401                       
                                   18402                         Format of IP fragment queue entries.  Entries are   
                                   18403                          sorted by IP address, then by ID number, and then  
                                   18404                          by fragment  offset.                               
                                   18405                       
0000000                00000 00010 18407              FRAG     RECORD BEGIN
 000000                            18415  1           FRAGNEXT   DS    A                   Next entry
 000004                            18416  1           FRAGHLEN   DS    F                   Fragment IP header length
 000008                            18417  1           FRAGOFF    DS    F                   Fragment offset
 00000C                            18418  1           FRAGLEN    DS    F                   Fragment data length
 000010                            18419  1           FRAGHDR    DS    0X                  Start of fragment IP header
                                   18420  1           FRAGSRC    EQU   FRAGHDR+(IPSRC-IPHDR),4,C'F'  IP source address
                                   18421  1           FRAGID     EQU   FRAGHDR+(IPID-IPHDR),2,C'H'   IP id
                                   18422  1           FRAGTTL    EQU   FRAGHDR+(IPTTL-IPHDR),1,C'C'  Time to live field
                                   18423  1           FRAGMORE   EQU   FRAGHDR+(IPFRAG-IPHDR),X'20',1  More fragments flag
 000010                00010 00010 18424                       END
-0027EA 90EF C020/4DE0_      00020 18434              RCVFRAG  PROC
 USING  *,R11
 00280E 1871                       18476                       LR    R7,R1               Save IP packet address
 USING  IPHDR,R7                   18477                       WITH  (IPHDR,R7)          ## IPHDR
 002810 1F66/BF63 7002             18490                       L2    R6,IPLEN            Get packet length
                                   18498                       
                                   18499                         Find point to insert new fragment in sorted fragment queue.  
                                   18500                       
 002816 4820 7006            00006 18501                       LH    R2,IPFRAG           IP fragment field
 00281A 5420 B27A            02A88 18502                       N     R2,=A(X'1FFF')      Isolate fragment offset
 00281E 8920 0003            00003 18503                       SLL   R2,3                Mult by 8 to get byte offset
 002822 4140 C0CC            000CC 18504                       LA    R4,NITFRAGQ-(FRAGNEXT-FRAG)  Init frag queue ptr
 USING  FRAG,R4                    18505                       WITH  (FRAG,R4)           Frag queue entry base
 002826                            18518                       LOOP  BEGIN
 002826 1854                       18524  1                      LR    R5,R4               Save prev queue ptr
 002828 BF4F 4000            00000 18525  1                      L4    R4,FRAGNEXT         Get next queue entry
 00282C 4780 B04A            02858 18527  1                      IF    Z,EXIT              Exit if end of queue
 002830 D503 401C 700C 0001C 0000C 18541  1                      CLC   FRAGSRC,IPSRC       Find first fragment queue
1AMELIA   RCVFRAG - Process received IP packet fragment                                                                     Page   77
0Current Usings:  (FRAG,R4) (IPHDR,R7) (*,R11) (NIT,R12)

0002836 4720 B018            02826 18542  1                      IF    H,NEXT               entry which is past where
 00283A 4740 B04A            02858 18556  1                      IF    L,EXIT                the new fragment will be
 00283E D501 4014 7004 00014 00004 18570  1                      CLC   FRAGID,IPID            inserted
